lines.content: This is a Chatterbot to help you manage your tasks. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
> Why couldn't the computer take its hat off? Its caps lock was on!
- add your tasks to a list
- display the task list when requested
- delete tasks from the task list
- mark tasks as done or undone
- search for task(s) based on a specific keyword
### Here are the steps to using it:
4. Watch as task-managing becomes ~~easier~~ ***so much*** easier!!! ðŸ˜‰
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the main method:
Here's what you'll be greeted by upon starting up ChatterBot:
`System.out.println("Hello! I'm " + logo + "\nWhat can I do for you?");`
What are you waiting for? Use it now!
event go home /from all day /to everyday
event eat egg party /from tdy /to tmr
* Represents the chatbot that is able to maintain a list of tasks.
protected static ArrayList<Task> list = new ArrayList<>();
* This is the main method which executes the ChatterBot program.
Parser.evaluateCommand(userMessage, ui, list, storage, file, taskList);
* Represents a task that has a deadline.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("OOPS!!! Invalid input! No task description.");
* Returns the description and deadline of the deadline task.
* @return String This is the deadline description and deadline in the format it will be displayed in, in the list.
* Returns the modified version of the deadline in an MMM d yyyy format.
* @return String This is the formatted deadline.
* Returns the input for the Chatterbot.txt file in the same format as was entered by the user.
* @return String This is the formatted line to add to the ChatterBot.txt file.
* Represents a task that is an event, with start and end times.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("OOPS!!! Invalid input! No task description.");
* Returns the description, start and end time of the event task.
* @return String This is the event description, start and end time in the format it will be displayed in,
* Returns the input for the Chatterbot.txt file in the same format as was entered by the user.
* @return String This is the formatted line to add to the ChatterBot.txt file.
* Represents the tasks that are added to the task list.
* Returns the status of the task (whether it is done or undone).
* @return String This shows the status of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* This method marks the task as done, denoted by [X].
* This method marks the task as undone, denoted by [ ].
* Returns the description of the task.
* @return String This is the task description in the format it will be displayed in, in the list.
* Returns the input for the Chatterbot.txt file in the same format as was entered by the user.
* @return String This is the formatted line to add to the ChatterBot.txt file.
* Represents a list of tasks that have been added.
* This method retrieves tasks from the ChatterBot.txt and loads them up into the task list.
* @param storage This is where the file and list contents are edited.
* This method converts the current task list to a string.
* @param list This is the current task list.
* @return String This is the formatted task list.
* Represents a task that just has a description.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("OOPS!!! Invalid input! No task description.");
* Returns the description of the todo task.
* @return String This is the todo description in the format it will be displayed in, in the list.
* Returns the input for the Chatterbot.txt file in the same format as was entered by the user.
* @return String This is the formatted line to add to the ChatterBot.txt file.
* Represents the interpretation of entered user inputs.
* Evaluates entered user inputs and calls the corresponding method.
* @param userMessage This is the entered user input.
* @param ui This is what will be returned to the user.
* @param list This is the current task list.
* @param storage This is where the file and list contents are edited.
* @param file This is the file path to retrieve the .txt file
* @param taskList This is the list of tasks that have been added.
public static void evaluateCommand(String userMessage, Ui ui, ArrayList<Task> list, Storage storage, String file,

* Prints a welcome message for the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm " + logo + "\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints a goodbye message for the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the current task list for the user.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints the tasks in list format that contain the entered keyword.
* @param toFind This is the entered keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Prints a success message to let the user know the task was marked successfully.
* @param toMark This is the task that will be marked.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + "[X] "
* Prints a success message to let the user know the task was unmarked successfully.
* @param toUnmark This is the task that will be unmarked.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + "[ ] "
* Prints a success message to let the user know the deadline task was added successfully,
* and the number of tasks they currently have.
* @param d This is the description and deadline of the added deadline task.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + d.toString() + "\nNow you have " + list.size()
* Prints a success message to let the user know the todo task was added successfully,
* and the number of tasks they currently have.
* @param td This is the description of the added todo task.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + td.toString() + "\nNow you have " + list.size()
* Prints a success message to let the user know the event task was added successfully,
* and the number of tasks they currently have.
* @param e This is the description, start and end time of the added event task.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + e.toString() + "\nNow you have " + list.size()
* Prints a success message to let the user know the task was deleted successfully.
* @param userMessage This is the task in the user input that will be deleted.
* Prints a message to tell the user the entered input is unknown by ChatterBot.
* @param userMessage This is the user input that is unknown.
// entered deadline will be added successfully
assertEquals("[D][ ] this assignment (by: Oct 12 2019)", new Deadline("this assignment","2019-10-12").toString());
// entered deadline will be added successfully
// entered event will be added successfully
assertEquals("[E][ ] birthday party (from: today to: tomorrow)", new Event("birthday party","today", "tomorrow").toString());
// entered event will be added successfully
assertEquals("[E][ ] training (from: morning to: evening)", new Event("training", "morning", "evening").toString());
// entered todo will be added successfully
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo this assignment", new Todo("todo this assignment").toString());
// entered todo will be added successfully
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo chores", new Todo("todo chores").toString());
// entered deadline will be added successfully
assertEquals("[D][ ] this assignment (by: Oct 12 2019)", new Deadline("this assignment","2019-10-12").toString());
// entered deadline will be added successfully
// entered event will be added successfully
assertEquals("[E][ ] birthday party (from: today to: tomorrow)", new Event("birthday party ","today ", "tomorrow").toString());
// entered event will be added successfully
assertEquals("[E][ ] training (from: morning to: evening)", new Event("training ", "morning ", "evening").toString());
// entered todo will be added successfully
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo this assignment", new Todo("todo this assignment").toString());
// entered todo will be added successfully
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo chores", new Todo("todo chores").toString());
